Output.Description:
Creates a new signal for each Feed Post. Every field on the feed post will become a signal attribute. [feedparser](https://pythonhosted.org/feedparser/index.html) has documentation on what fields can be expected from [rss](https://pythonhosted.org/feedparser/common-rss-elements.html) and [atom](https://pythonhosted.org/feedparser/common-atom-elements.html) feeds. Feed fields will be prepended with `feed_`. The attribute `updated` will be set even if the feed format does not have it (ex. for rss feeds `updated` is set to `pubDate`. The following is a list of commonly include attributes, but note that not all will be included on every signal:
```
{
updated: datetime,
id: string,
feed_title: string,
title: string,
summary: string,
link: string
}
```

lookback.description: On block start, look back this amount of time to grab old posts.

retry_interval.description: When a url request fails, how long to wait before attempting to try again.

polling_interval.description: How often API is polled. When using more than one query. Each query will be polled at a period equal to the `polling_interval` times the number of `queries`.

retry_limit.description: When a url request fails, number of times to attempt a retry before giving up.

get_updates.description: When True, an attempt is made to output a signal when a post is updated.

queries.description: List of Feed URLs to get posts from.
